p: In addition to Proteobacteria, Actinobacteriota (peak abundance in DCl I), Acidobacteriota (peak abundance in DCl III), and Verrucomicrobiota (peak abundance in DCl V) were detected in our P. abies logs. These three phyla have been commonly found in bacterial communities colonizing deadwood from P. abies and other tree species ( Sun et al., 2014; Hoppe et al., 2015; Kielak et al., 2016a; Rinta-Kanto et al., 2016; Tl√°skal et al., 2017; Johnston et al., 2019). Within Actinobacteriota, Solirubrobacterales accounted for the highest relative abundance in our study. Some members of Solirubrobacterales can act as lignin-degraders ( Wilhelm et al., 2019), which might explain both their presence in all DCls and their peak abundance in DCl I.
